Primary Contact: Bren Currie, Team Leader, Okanagan Service Delivery Area
Service Details: - Provides a range of support for families of children and youth with a diagnosis of a developmental disability, a diagnosis of Autism Spectrum Disorder or who are eligible for the At Home Program- Services are intended to help promote children's healthy development, maximize quality of life and assist families in their role as primary caregivers- Not all Family Support Services are available in every communityServices:- Respite Services:  Provides funding directly to families to purchase the respite services that best meet their needs- Professional Support Services:  Provides specialized support services by qualified professionals including assessment, training, counselling, planning and other supports to children, families and caregivers- Child and Youth Care Worker:  Provides a specialized child-care worker who assists the child to learn social and life skills, and/or to support the family to learn parenting/child management skills- Parent Support Program:  Provides a range of services to assist parents and/or children to develop skills and access information and community programs, and may include parent support groups, parent skills training, counselling, life skills and organized activities- Homemaker Support:  Provides home support services including direct care of children and training in household management skills on a short term, on-going, intermittent or as needed basis- Behavioural Support:  Provides consultation, training, and development and monitoring of individualized positive behaviour support plans for children and youth and their families
